root_causes: Missing the custom validation referenced in question_attributes (validateB5d(...)) — the script only checks numeric range and does not implement the cross-field / business-rule validation required.
No enforcement of the declared precision (Precision = 4) — script does not check decimal places.
Does not respect the ColumnMask logic (question_attributes ColumnMask references column "4") — script blindly checks all four subvariables rather than applying column-specific logic/visibility rules.
No explicit handling for any special codes or other open-text/exception codes (if required by survey coding conventions).
instructions: Implement the validateB5d logic specified in question_attributes (validateB5d("S7_4","B5dx4_4","hDUMB5dCol4_2","B5dDKx4")); this likely requires additional checks between S7_4, B5dx4_4, hDUMB5dCol4_2 and B5dDKx4 and must be run for the appropriate column/variable.

Apply ColumnMask behavior: limit validations to variables/columns that are visible/applicable (for this question the ColumnMask references column "4", so ensure the column-specific checks target B5dx4_4 when mask indicates).
Add a precision check to ensure values do not exceed 4 decimal places (e.g., test whether ROUND(v,4) = v or otherwise flag values with more than 4 decimals).
Retain the numeric range check (v >= 0 and v <= 9999) but combine it with the custom validation above so both numeric-range and business-rule validations are enforced.

If the project uses survey special codes (97/98/99), decide whether they should be allowed and explicitly handle them (exclude them from numeric-range checks or treat them as valid codes) — update sel-if logic accordingly.

No enforcement of the declared precision (Precision = 4) — script does not check decimal places.

instructions: Implement the validateB5d logic specified in question_attributes (validateB5d("S7_5","B5dx5_4","hDUMB5dCol5_2","B5dDKx5")); this will enforce any cross-field/business rules required for column 5 and the referenced variables.

If special survey codes (97/98/99) are used, explicitly handle them (exclude them from numeric-range enforcement or treat as valid), and update the selection logic accordingly.

root_causes: Incorrect variable name used in the script: expected variable is B5dDKx1_5 (per expected logic) but script references B5dDKx1.
Because of the wrong variable name, the script does not validate the intended subvariable and thus does not enforce the question's logic.
instructions: Change all references from B5dDKx1 to the correct variable name B5dDKx1_5 in the sel and list statements.

Keep the validation logic for allowed value 5 (i.e., select cases where miss(B5dDKx1_5) or B5dDKx1_5 not equal to 5), but ensure the ColumnMask behavior (ColumnMask references set("1")) is respected if applicable.
If there are any project-specific special codes (97/98/99) that should be allowed/excluded, incorporate handling for them after confirming coding conventions.
